description: I’m deeply engaged in AI alignment and existential risks, concerned that advanced models might drift from their intended goals, so I monitor safety research breakthroughs—methods, benchmarks, and protocols—empirical experiments that reveal misalignment, policy and regulatory updates, and documented failures or accidents across sources like the AI 2027 blog and Guardian reporting to spot early warning signals. I’m also interested in quantum computing’s practical and scientific applications and their broader societal, economic, and ethical impacts.
userInterests: The user wants to stay informed about the Russia-Ukraine war across multiple dimensions. They follow frontline military developments, the humanitarian crisis (refugee flows and aid efforts), and international diplomacy including sanctions. They also track economic and energy impacts on global markets, as well as information and cyber-warfare aspects. Their goal is comprehensive, up-to-date coverage rather than a specific academic or activist focus.

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Latest refinery strike shows ‘no safe places in Russia’s deep rear’
curatedArticles.trailText: Bashneft oil refinery in Ufa is 1,400km from Ukrainian border; Zelenskyy says Trump can repeat Middle East peace success in Ukraine. What we know on day 1,327

curatedArticles.title: ‘Massive’ Russian attack on Ukraine capital causes widespread blackout
curatedArticles.trailText: At least 20 injured after hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles target energy infrastructure in Kyiv

curatedArticles.title: Trump sanctions have swift impact but will world stop buying Russian oil and gas?
curatedArticles.trailText: Analysts say president’s war on Russia’s fossil fuel revenues is a chance to bring peace to Ukraine and profit to US

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Zelenskyy visits troops near embattled Pokrovsk
curatedArticles.trailText: Deep Ukrainian drone strikes hit petrochemical plant 1,300km inside Russia and Lukoil refinery east of Moscow. What we know on day 1,351

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Kyiv gets more US-made Patriots and says its forces are holding on in Pokrovsk
curatedArticles.trailText: Zelenskyy says the air defence systems being put into action while in embattled eastern city Russian troops haven’t advanced over past day. What we know on day 1,350

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Trump ‘not really’ considering supplying Tomahawks
curatedArticles.trailText: Turkish refineries cut back on Russian oil in response to sanctions; Ukrainian special forces join defence of embattled Pokrovsk. What we know on day 1,349

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine deploys special forces to Pokrovsk in effort to hold key city
curatedArticles.trailText: Escalating battle for city comes as overnight Russian drone and missile strikes kill six people, including two children

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Ukraine says its troops still holding out in embattled Pokrovsk
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukraine military says it has improved positions in several districts, while Moscow says its troops are enclosing in on Ukrainian forces.

curatedArticles.title: Russia bombards Ukraine’s gas sites as Zelenskyy flies to US for Trump meeting
curatedArticles.trailText: Strikes cause outages in eight regions before Washington talks to discuss US providing Kyiv with cruise missiles

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Russian attacks on substations are ‘nuclear terrorism’, says Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukrainian foreign ministry says deliberate strikes on civilian energy facilities violate international law as fears of a winter crisis grow. What we know on day 1,347

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Putin boasts of nuclear-driven torpedo that would swamp cities with radioactive tsunami
curatedArticles.trailText: Russian president proclaims test of Poseidon which would launch from submarine and carry nuclear engine and warhead. What we know on day 1,345

curatedArticles.title: Russian drone attacks on civilians in Ukraine are war crimes, UN report concludes
curatedArticles.trailText: Rights commission inquiry focused on south-east of country found drones targeted gathering points and critical infrastructure

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Russian drones hunt civilians in crime against humanity, UN inquiry finds
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukraine strengthens Pokrovsk positions amid infiltration by estimated 200 Russian troops; Lukoil selling overseas assets after US sanctions. What we know on day 1,343

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Ukrainians may get Gripen fighter jets bought with Russian money
curatedArticles.trailText: Double dose of Russian oil sanctions from EU and US; freezing war at current frontlines is ‘good compromise’, says Zelenskyy. What we know on day 1,338

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Repairs begin in bid to restore power to Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
curatedArticles.trailText: UN watchdog says Russia and Ukraine have established special ceasefire zones to allow the repairs to be safely carried out. What we know on day 1,334

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Zelenskyy ‘realistic’ about chances of Tomahawk missile deal
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukraine president suggests after talks that the door may not be entirely closed on deal for US long-range missiles; Zelenskyy has ‘productive’ call with European leaders. What we know on day 1,333

curatedArticles.title: ‘The key to success is in the sky’: the Ukrainian defenders struggling to stem Russia’s air assault
curatedArticles.trailText: War in the air is becoming increasingly significant as conflict on the ground becomes bogged down

curatedArticles.title: Trump says he plans to meet Putin in Budapest as Zelenskyy prepares to make missiles case at White House
curatedArticles.trailText: US president has repeatedly hinted at supplying Kyiv with Tomahawks but some in Moscow say Kremlin sees it as negotiating gambit

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Poland minister shows Shahed drone and warns of ‘deep’ Russian threat
curatedArticles.trailText: Radosław Sikorski, speaking in London, urges drone wall and three-year plan to back Ukraine; Odesa mayor’s ‘citizenship suspended’. What we know on day 1,330

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Crimea oil depot burns as Russia feels effects on fuel supply
curatedArticles.trailText: Glide bombs knock out power supply and hit hospital in Kharkiv; Zelenskyy lining up Trump meeting with Tomahawks hot topic. What we know on day 1,329

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Moscow voices ‘extreme concern’ at Trump threat to send Tomahawk missiles to Kyiv
curatedArticles.trailText: US president says he may warn Russian counterpart ‘look, if this war is not going to get settled, I’m going to send them Tomahawks’. What we know on day 1,328

curatedArticles.title: Zelenskyy urges Trump to use Gaza ceasefire momentum to broker peace in Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukrainian leader discussed request for Tomahawk cruise missiles in phone call with US president

curatedArticles.title: ‘Our job is to maximise their losses’: how Ukraine’s forces attempt to claw back against Russian advances
curatedArticles.trailText: Along Donetsk’s frontline, a small counteroffensive by Ukrainian troops aims to help change perceptions about the war among Kyiv’s western allies

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Power restored to Kyiv after Russia drone attacks
curatedArticles.trailText: Zelenskyy says attacks targeted energy infrastructure as winter looms; boy killed as drones and missiles hit Zaporizhzhia. What we know on day 1,326

curatedArticles.title: Oil price jumps and FTSE 100 hits new high after Trump puts sanctions on Russian firms
curatedArticles.trailText: Assets in US belonging to Rosneft and Lukoil frozen as shares in Shell and BP rise by 3%

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Zelenskyy urges US to expand Russia oil sanctions
curatedArticles.trailText: At a meeting with European leaders, the Ukrainian president also discusses the supply of long-range missiles. What we know on day 1,340

curatedArticles.title: As the US flip-flops on the path to peace, Europe’s ‘coalition of the willing’ rallies round Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: From unanimity on a reparations loan to the unpredictability of Trump, EU leaders will gather this week with agreement on ending the war still fraught with hurdles

curatedArticles.title: Trump downplays hopes he will supply Ukraine with US missiles after meeting with Zelenskyy
curatedArticles.trailText: US president seemed more intent on brokering a peace deal after surprise phone call with Putin earlier in day

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Putin back in Trump’s ear as soon as Tomahawks came up, says Zelenskyy
curatedArticles.trailText: US president reveals plan to meet Russian ruler again as Ukrainian president visits Washington; EU’s fuel importers will have to prove it’s not Russian. What we know on day 1,332

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: British ex-soldier arrested in Kyiv and accused of spying for Russia
curatedArticles.trailText: Prosecutors allege man was conducting training for Ukraine’s army when he was recruited by the FSB, Moscow’s spy bureau. What we know on day 1,346

curatedArticles.title: Russian army chiefs torturing and executing soldiers who refuse to fight in Ukraine, report says
curatedArticles.trailText: Investigation lists 101 superiors accused of tactics such as using drones to ‘finish’ off retreating troops and sending soldiers on death missions

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Moscow under drone siege for third night running
curatedArticles.trailText: EU edges towards using ‘reparations loan’ using Russian frozen assets; Kremlin pressing ahead with year-round conscription. What we know on day 1,344

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Russia claims test of nuclear-powered missile condemned as ‘flying Chornobyl’
curatedArticles.trailText: Burevestnik stayed in air for 15 hours, defence minister tells Vladimir Putin; Ukrainian drones close Moscow airports. What we know on day 1,342

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: US reportedly mulling further sanctions on Russia that could hit banking sector
curatedArticles.trailText: Trump said he would not schedule any talks with Putin unless it was clear that the Russian leader was serious about ending the war. What we know on day 1,341

curatedArticles.title: EU has a plan to use frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine – how will it work?
curatedArticles.trailText: What are the legal implications, and why does Belgium fear being left alone with the bill?

curatedArticles.title: Zelenskyy calls Trump’s proposal to freeze war at current frontlines ‘good compromise’
curatedArticles.trailText: US president’s remark seen as modest win for Ukrainian leader, who acknowledges Russia will not accept proposal

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Zelenskyy paints Trump meeting as ‘positive’, with Patriot missile deal in works
curatedArticles.trailText: Zelenskyy’s comments are in contrast to reports that Trump berated the Ukrainian leader and pushed him to concede territory to Russia. What we know on day 1,336

curatedArticles.title: Monday briefing: ‘New levels of misery’ for Ukraine’s soldiers as diplomatic wrangling drags on
curatedArticles.trailText: In today’s newsletter: Trump’s stance on the war continues to oscillate while Zelenskyy’s infantry face gruelling stints at the ‘zero line’ amid increasingly lethal Russian attacks

curatedArticles.title: European leaders near deal to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: Plans to secure loan with Russian funds ‘moving to happy resolution’, says Polish foreign minister

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Energy war continues with strikes on Russian oil and gas plants
curatedArticles.trailText: Russian attacks hit coal mine in Dnipropetrovsk region and Chernihiv power grid; Trump flips back to accommodating Putin. What we know on day 1,335

curatedArticles.title: What are Tomahawk missiles and why does Ukraine want them?
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukraine argues missiles would compel Russia to take Donald Trump’s calls for negotiations to end war more seriously

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: 23 children and adolescents brought out of Russian-occupied areas
curatedArticles.trailText: Rescue carried out under the president’s ‘Bring Kids Back UA’ programme; power cut in capital and several injured - What we know on day 1,325

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Storm Shadow missiles ‘hit gunpowder plant in Russia’
curatedArticles.trailText: Russians confirm attack on Bryansk region home to explosives factory; Trump-Putin talks shelved, US diplomacy ‘going in circles’. What we know on day 1,337

curatedArticles.title: Latest EU sanctions against Russia target liquefied natural gas
curatedArticles.trailText: Measures also add 117 shadow fleet vessels to list of those suspected of illegal oil shipments and banned from ports

curatedArticles.title: Children among six killed in Kyiv after Russian missile and drone attack
curatedArticles.trailText: Strikes, involving over 400 drones and 28 missiles, launched hours after Putin-Trump meeting in Budapest cancelled

curatedArticles.title: Zelenskyy to visit London for talks before expected Trump-Putin summit
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukrainian president will seek to win security guarantees at ‘coalition of the willing’ meeting before any US-Russia talks

curatedArticles.title: Trump suggests carving up Ukraine’s Donbas region to end war after meeting with Zelenskyy
curatedArticles.trailText: Trump made the comments after a tense meeting with Zelenskyy in which the Ukraine leader failed to secure supplies of Tomahawk missiles

curatedArticles.title: Russian drone incursion ‘tactically stupid and counterproductive’ says Polish minister
curatedArticles.trailText: Poland’s foreign minister, Radek Sikorski, has said that Vladimir Putin had consolidated western opinion against him with the incursion

curatedArticles.title: Ukrainian computer game-style drone attack system goes ‘viral’
curatedArticles.trailText: System rewards soldiers who achieve strikes with points that can be used to buy more weapons in an online store

curatedArticles.title: Wildfires have consumed vast chunks of Ukraine. Is Russia deliberately fuelling the flames?
curatedArticles.trailText: In 2024, nearly a million hectares of Ukraine’s land burned. Heat, mines and shelling contributed, but footage of drones targeting firefighters has raised the question of war crimes

curatedArticles.title: Russian cyber-attacks against Nato states up by 25% in a year, analysis finds
curatedArticles.trailText: Microsoft report says sector most targeted by Russian state cyber-activity was government amid warnings of Kremlin’s ‘hybrid warfare’

curatedArticles.title: Wives, mothers, fighters, activists: the millennial women keeping Ukraine going
curatedArticles.trailText: Born into an independent Ukraine, the lives of these young women changed for ever when Russia invaded their country, forcing them to shoulder huge burdens of responsibility

curatedArticles.title: Trump describes Russia’s new cruise missile test as ‘not appropriate’
curatedArticles.trailText: US president says Vladimir Putin should focus on ending war with Ukraine rather than testing missiles

curatedArticles.title: ‘I wanted to do something more meaningful’: the Chinese nationals fighting for Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: Volunteers defy their government and public opinion in China to risk their lives for an adversary of Beijing’s main geopolitical partner

description: The user is personally curious about the fields of protein folding and nuclear fusion, driven by their potential to revolutionize healthcare through disease treatment and to provide sustainable energy solutions. This interest is fueled by the transformative impact these advancements could have on the future of humanity.
